extendedInfo.description: A simple utility to automatically turn ON or OFF  the screen by detecting the proximity sensor, instead of pressing power button manually. A convenient widget is also provided to indicate it's current status.Sometimes the power button is hard to press, or you want to save protect the hardware power button for longer use. This app and provided notification/widget can save you from accessing the power button all the time.Feature:1. By detecting p-sensor, automatically turn on/off the screen for you.2. Allows you to only enable the function during charging.3. Allows you to disable the feature when the screen is rotated.4. You can set separate timeout values for screen on/off delay to prevent from accidentally triggering the feature.5. A widget is supported to quickly toggle the function.6. Notification is supported to quickly toggle function, or directly turn screen off.7. NEW Power Save Mode: works on some devices. Try if it works for YOU!Usage:0. Modify Settings in "Auto Screen Settings" app and enable the functionor 1. Add widget "AutoScreenOnOff" to your home screen2. Press once on the icon to trigger Device Management Confirmation Dialog.3. Agree to activate device management. (This is required to turn off the screen)4. Now everything should work now. Try cover your hand over the top area of the screen (where the proximity sensor might be located) to see if it works.Attention:- Since it uses proximity sensor to detect whether the screen should be on or off, this may use some power consumption. So, if you are not using your device for a long time, suggest you turning off the function.- If you wants to uninstall the app, please do it from top of the app. Translation Helps from:Hai Long Hoang: VietnameseWebFrogeye : FrenchJÃ¡n KuÄera: SlovakRenek: Czechps. If you have any suggestions, questions, bug reports, or you are willing to help translate strings, please send me email. leinadkao@gmail.com

reviews.title: Nice app, but not work well in Xperia S
reviews.comment: I am using 6.2.B.1.96 (android 4.1.2). When I use this app to turn off the screen, it can\'t off and go to the lock screen. It seems it is a bug. After fix it, I will give 5 stars :)

reviews.title: HTC One
reviews.comment: Destroys my battery!!! But works perfect. Even with option to save battery it\'s using as much battery as my the screen it\'s self. 26% battery in 8 hours. It\'s a little much. Needs to go.

reviews.title: Locks on screen off
reviews.comment: This app should not lock device on screen off. Every time i turn it up it asks for unlock. I keep password to lock device instead of slide hence, it becomes tiresome to enter pass word each time. Will change rating, once problem is solved.

reviews.title: Working great!
reviews.comment: Working great in my Xperia Z, and no battery drain, maybe little bit but not noticeably.  Just one problem, sometimes if I plug or unplug the power, AutoscreenOnOff will kill itself, so weird.
reviews.author: Henry b

reviews.title: Work\'s Good!!  But??
reviews.comment: Work\'s Really Great,  BUT it would be Nice to have Lock Noise Or some kind of Sound so you know for sure that your Screen is off!!   Like the sound when you  \"Lock The Phone\" it makes a Click Sound!!!!    But even with out the Click Sound,  It Work\'s Great..    5+ Stars To The Developer,  and many thanks for Him Or Her Coming up with the Idea!!!!!!!
reviews.author: Dean Welch

reviews.title: All function works and are very responsive,  except....
reviews.comment: For some reason, I couldn\'t get the \'temporarily disable in landscape\' function work for my Samsung galaxy tab 7.0 plus. The interesting thing is smart cover function is disable when I use the tablet in portrait mode and \'landscape disable\' is on.... but the function is not disable for landscape mode while I turn on the \'landscape disable\'
